service:
You can use the Cost Optimization Hub API to programmatically identify, filter, aggregate, and quantify savings for your cost optimization recommendations across multiple Amazon Web Services Regions and Amazon Web Services accounts in your organization.

The Cost Optimization Hub API provides the following endpoint:

  • https://cost-optimization-hub.us-east-1.amazonaws.com

operations.GetPreferences: Returns a set of preferences for an account in order to add account-specific preferences into the service. These preferences impact how the savings associated with recommendations are presentedâ€”estimated savings after discounts or estimated savings before discounts, for example.
operations.GetRecommendation:
Returns both the current and recommended resource configuration and the estimated cost impact for a recommendation.

The recommendationId is only valid for up to a maximum of 24 hours as recommendations are refreshed daily. To retrieve the recommendationId, use the ListRecommendations API.
operations.ListEfficiencyMetrics:
Returns cost efficiency metrics aggregated over time and optionally grouped by a specified dimension. The metrics provide insights into your cost optimization progress by tracking estimated savings, spending, and measures how effectively you're optimizing your Cloud resources.

The operation supports both daily and monthly time granularities and allows grouping results by account ID, Amazon Web Services Region. Results are returned as time-series data, enabling you to analyze trends in your cost optimization performance over the specified time period.
operations.ListEnrollmentStatuses: Retrieves the enrollment status for an account. It can also return the list of accounts that are enrolled under the organization.
operations.ListRecommendationSummaries:
Returns a concise representation of savings estimates for resources. Also returns de-duped savings across different types of recommendations.

The following filters are not supported for this API: recommendationIds, resourceArns, and resourceIds.
operations.UpdateEnrollmentStatus:
Updates the enrollment (opt in and opt out) status of an account to the Cost Optimization Hub service.

If the account is a management account of an organization, this action can also be used to enroll member accounts of the organization.

You must have the appropriate permissions to opt in to Cost Optimization Hub and to view its recommendations. When you opt in, Cost Optimization Hub automatically creates a service-linked role in your account to access its data.
operations.UpdatePreferences: Updates a set of preferences for an account in order to add account-specific preferences into the service. These preferences impact how the savings associated with recommendations are presented.

AccessDeniedException.base: You are not authorized to use this operation with the given parameters.

AccountEnrollmentStatus.base: Describes the enrollment status of an organization's member accounts in Cost Optimization Hub.

refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesResponse$items: The enrollment status of a specific account ID, including creation and last updated timestamps.

refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesRequest$accountId: The account ID of a member account in the organization.

refs.Filter$accountIds: The account to which the recommendation applies.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$actionType: The type of action you can take by adopting the recommendation.

refs.Filter$actionTypes: The type of action you can take by adopting the recommendation.

refs.Ec2AutoScalingGroupConfiguration$allocat: The strategy used for allocating instances, based on a predefined priority order or based on the lowest available price.

AuroraDbClusterStorage.base: Contains the details of an Aurora DB cluster storage.

refs.ResourceDetails$auroraDbClusterStorage: The Aurora DB cluster storage recommendation details.

AuroraDbClusterStorageConfiguration.base: The Aurora DB cluster storage configuration used for recommendations.

refs.AuroraDbClusterStorage$configuration: The Aurora DB cluster storage configuration used for recommendations.

BlockStoragePerformanceConfiguration.base: Describes the Amazon Elastic Block Store performance configuration of the current and recommended resource configuration for a recommendation.

refs.EbsVolumeConfiguration$performance: The Amazon Elastic Block Store performance configuration.

refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$sizeFl: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.ElastiCacheReservedInstancesConfiguratio: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.Filter$restartNeeded: Whether or not implementing the recommendation requires a restart.
refs.Filter$rollbackPossible: Whether or not implementing the recommendation can be rolled back.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$restartNeeded: Whether or not implementing the recommendation requires a restart.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$rollbackPossib: Whether or not implementing the recommendation can be rolled back.
refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesResponse$includeMe: The enrollment status of all member accounts in the organization if the account is the management account or delegated administrator.
refs.MemoryDbReservedInstancesConfiguration$s: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.OpenSearchReservedInstancesConfiguration: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.RdsReservedInstancesConfiguration$sizeFl: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.Recommendation$restartNeeded: Whether or not implementing the recommendation requires a restart.
refs.Recommendation$rollbackPossible: Whether or not implementing the recommendation can be rolled back.
refs.RedshiftReservedInstancesConfiguration$s: Determines whether the recommendation is size flexible.
refs.UpdateEnrollmentStatusRequest$includeMem: Indicates whether to enroll member accounts of the organization if the account is the management account or delegated administrator.

ComputeConfiguration.base: Describes the performance configuration for compute services such as Amazon EC2, Lambda, and ECS.

ComputeSavingsPlansConfiguration.base: The Compute Savings Plans configuration used for recommendations.

refs.ComputeSavingsPlans$configuration: Configuration details of the Compute Savings Plans to purchase.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$lastRefreshTim: The time when the recommendation was last generated.
refs.Recommendation$lastRefreshTimestamp: The time when the recommendation was last generated.

DbInstanceConfiguration.base: The DB instance configuration used for recommendations.

refs.BlockStoragePerformanceConfiguration$iop: The number of I/O operations per second.
refs.ComputeConfiguration$vCpu: The number of vCPU cores in the resource.
refs.EstimatedDiscounts$otherDiscount: Estimated other discounts include all discounts that are not itemized. Itemized discounts include reservedInstanceDiscount and savingsPlansDiscount.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$estimatedSavin: The estimated savings percentage relative to the total cost over the cost calculation lookback period.
The estimated savings amount over the lookback period used to calculate cost impact for a recommendation.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$estimatedMonth: The estimated monthly savings amount for the recommendation.
The estimated monthly cost of the current resource. For Reserved Instances and Savings Plans, it refers to the cost for eligible usage.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesResponse$esti: The total overall savings for the aggregated view.
refs.MetricsByTime$score: The efficiency score for this time period. The score represents a measure of how effectively the cloud resources are being optimized, with higher scores indicating better optimization performance.
refs.MetricsByTime$savings: The estimated savings amount for this time period, representing the potential cost reduction achieved through optimization recommendations.
refs.MetricsByTime$spend: The total spending amount for this time period.
refs.RdsDbInstanceStorageConfiguration$alloca: The new amount of storage in GB to allocate for the DB instance.
refs.RdsDbInstanceStorageConfiguration$iops: The amount of Provisioned IOPS (input/output operations per second) to be initially allocated for the DB instance.
refs.RdsDbInstanceStorageConfiguration$storag: The storage throughput for the DB instance.
refs.Recommendation$estimatedMonthlySavings: The estimated monthly savings amount for the recommendation.
refs.Recommendation$estimatedSavingsPercentag: The estimated savings percentage relative to the total cost over the cost calculation lookback period.
refs.Recommendation$estimatedMonthlyCost: The estimated monthly cost of the current resource. For Reserved Instances and Savings Plans, it refers to the cost for eligible usage.
refs.RecommendationSummary$estimatedMonthlySa: The estimated total savings resulting from modifications, on a monthly basis.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$estimatedOnDema: The remaining On-Demand cost estimated to not be covered by the recommended reserved instance, over the length of the lookback period.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$monthlyReservat: The cost of paying for the recommended reserved instance monthly.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$savingsPercenta: The savings percentage relative to the total On-Demand costs that are associated with this instance.
refs.ReservedInstancesPricing$estimatedMonthl: The estimated cost of your recurring monthly fees for the recommended reserved instance across the month.
refs.ResourcePricing$estimatedCostBeforeDisco: The savings estimate using Amazon Web Services public pricing without incorporating any discounts.
refs.ResourcePricing$estimatedNetUnusedAmorti: The estimated net unused amortized commitment for the recommendation.
refs.ResourcePricing$estimatedCostAfterDiscou: The savings estimate incorporating all discounts with Amazon Web Services, such as Reserved Instances and Savings Plans.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$monthlySavingsPlansE: The cost of paying for the recommended Savings Plans monthly.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$estimatedMonthlyComm: Estimated monthly commitment for the Savings Plans.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$savingsPercentage: Estimated savings as a percentage of your overall costs after buying the Savings Plans.
refs.SavingsPlansPricing$estimatedOnDemandCos: Estimated On-Demand cost you will pay after buying the Savings Plans.

DynamoDbReservedCapacityConfiguration.base: The DynamoDB reserved capacity configuration used for recommendations.

refs.DynamoDbReservedCapacity$configuration: The DynamoDB reserved capacity configuration used for recommendations.

EbsVolume.base: Describes the Amazon Elastic Block Store volume configuration of the current and recommended resource configuration for a recommendation.

refs.ResourceDetails$ebsVolume: The Amazon Elastic Block Store volume recommendation details.

EbsVolumeConfiguration.base: The Amazon Elastic Block Store volume configuration used for recommendations.

refs.EbsVolume$configuration: The Amazon Elastic Block Store volume configuration used for recommendations.

Ec2AutoScalingGroup.base: The EC2 Auto Scaling group recommendation details.

refs.ResourceDetails$ec2AutoScalingGroup: The EC2 Auto Scaling group recommendation details.

Ec2AutoScalingGroupConfiguration.base: The EC2 Auto Scaling group configuration used for recommendations.

refs.Ec2AutoScalingGroup$configuration: The EC2 Auto Scaling group configuration used for recommendations.

refs.Ec2AutoScalingGroupConfiguration$type: The type of EC2 Auto Scaling group, showing whether it consists of a single instance type or mixed instance types.

Ec2Instance.base: Describes the EC2 instance configuration of the current and recommended resource configuration for a recommendation.

Ec2InstanceConfiguration.base: The EC2 instance configuration used for recommendations.

refs.Ec2Instance$configuration: The EC2 instance configuration used for recommendations.

Ec2InstanceSavingsPlans.base: The EC2 instance Savings Plans recommendation details.

refs.ResourceDetails$ec2InstanceSavingsPlans: The EC2 instance Savings Plans recommendation details.

Ec2InstanceSavingsPlansConfiguration.base: The EC2 instance Savings Plans configuration used for recommendations.

refs.Ec2InstanceSavingsPlans$configuration: The EC2 instance Savings Plans configuration used for recommendations.

Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration.base: The EC2 reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.Ec2ReservedInstances$configuration: The EC2 reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

EcsServiceConfiguration.base: The ECS service configuration used for recommendations.

refs.EcsService$configuration: The ECS service configuration used for recommendations.

EfficiencyMetricsByGroup.base: Contains cost efficiency metrics for a specific group over time. The group is defined by the grouping dimension specified in the request, such as account ID, Amazon Web Services Region.

refs.EfficiencyMetricsByGroupList$member: An individual group's cost efficiency metrics over time.

EfficiencyMetricsByGroupList.base: A list of cost efficiency metrics grouped by the specified dimension.

refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsResponse$efficiency: A list of cost efficiency metrics grouped by the specified dimension. Each group contains time-series data points with cost efficiency, potential savings, and optimzable spend for the specified time period.

ElastiCacheReservedInstancesConfiguratio.base: The ElastiCache reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.ElastiCacheReservedInstances$configurati: The ElastiCache reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

EstimatedDiscounts.base: Estimated discount details of the current and recommended resource configuration for a recommendation.

Filter.base: Describes a filter that returns a more specific list of recommendations. Filters recommendations by different dimensions.

refs.ListRecommendationsRequest$filter: The constraints that you want all returned recommendations to match.

GranularityType.base: The time granularity for aggregating the cost efficiency metrics.

refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsRequest$granularity: The time granularity for the cost efficiency metrics. Specify Daily for metrics aggregated by day, or Monthly for metrics aggregated by month.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$implementation: The effort required to implement the recommendation.

refs.Filter$implementationEfforts: The effort required to implement the recommendation.

refs.Ec2AutoScalingGroupConfiguration$instanc: Details about the instance for the EC2 Auto Scaling group with a single instance type.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$recommendation: The lookback period that's used to generate the recommendation.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$costCalculatio: The lookback period used to calculate cost impact for a recommendation.
refs.Recommendation$recommendationLookbackPer: The lookback period that's used to generate the recommendation.

InternalServerException.base: An error on the server occurred during the processing of your request. Try again later.

LambdaFunctionConfiguration.base: The Lambda function configuration used for recommendations.

refs.LambdaFunction$configuration: The Lambda function configuration used for recommendations.

refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of groups to return in the response. Valid values range from 0 to 1000. Use in conjunction with nextToken to paginate through results when the total number of groups exceeds this limit.

refs.ListRecommendationSummariesRequest$maxRe: The maximum number of recommendations to be returned for the request.

refs.ListRecommendationsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of recommendations that are returned for the request.

refs.NatGatewayConfiguration$activeConnection: The number of active connections through the NAT Gateway.
refs.NatGatewayConfiguration$packetsInFromSou: The number of packets received from the source through the NAT Gateway.
refs.NatGatewayConfiguration$packetsInFromDes: The number of packets received from the destination through the NAT Gateway.

refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of objects that are returned for the request.

refs.GetPreferencesResponse$memberAccountDisc: Retrieves the status of the "member account discount visibility" preference.
refs.UpdatePreferencesResponse$memberAccountD: Shows the status of the "member account discount visibility" preference.

MemoryDbReservedInstances.base:
The MemoryDB reserved instances recommendation details.

While the API reference uses "MemoryDB reserved instances", the user guide and other documentation refer to them as "MemoryDB reserved nodes", as the terms are used interchangeably.

MemoryDbReservedInstancesConfiguration.base:
The MemoryDB reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

While the API reference uses "MemoryDB reserved instances", the user guide and other documentation refer to them as "MemoryDB reserved nodes", as the terms are used interchangeably.

refs.MemoryDbReservedInstances$configuration: The MemoryDB reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

MetricsByTime.base: Contains efficiency metrics for a specific point in time, including an efficiency score, potential savings, optimizable spend, and timestamp.

refs.MetricsByTimeList$member: A single time-series data point containing efficiency metrics.

MetricsByTimeList.base: A list of time-series efficiency metric data points.

refs.EfficiencyMetricsByGroup$metricsByTime: A list of time-series data points containing efficiency metrics for this group. Each data point includes an efficiency score, estimated savings, spending, and a timestamp corresponding to the specified granularity. This field is null when efficiency metrics cannot be calculated for the group, in which case the message field provides an explanation.

MixedInstanceConfiguration.base: The configuration for the EC2 Auto Scaling group with mixed instance types.

refs.Ec2AutoScalingGroupConfiguration$mixedIn: A list of instance types for an EC2 Auto Scaling group with mixed instance types.

NatGatewayConfiguration.base: The NAT Gateway configuration used for recommendations.

refs.NatGateway$configuration: The NAT Gateway configuration used for recommendations.

OpenSearchReservedInstancesConfiguration.base: The OpenSearch reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.OpenSearchReservedInstances$configuratio: The OpenSearch reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.OrderBy$order: The order that's used to sort the data.

OrderBy.base: Defines how rows will be sorted in the response.

refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsRequest$orderBy: The ordering specification for the results. Defines which dimension to sort by and whether to sort in ascending or descending order.
refs.ListRecommendationsRequest$orderBy: The ordering of recommendations by a dimension.

refs.PreferredCommitment$paymentOption: The preferred upfront payment structure for commitments. If the value is null, it will default to AllUpfront (highest savings) where applicable.

PreferredCommitment.base: The preferred configuration for Reserved Instances and Savings Plans commitment-based discounts, consisting of a payment option and a commitment duration.

refs.GetPreferencesResponse$preferredCommitme: Retrieves the current preferences for how Reserved Instances and Savings Plans cost-saving opportunities are prioritized in terms of payment option and term length.
refs.UpdatePreferencesRequest$preferredCommit: Sets the preferences for how Reserved Instances and Savings Plans cost-saving opportunities are prioritized in terms of payment option and term length.
refs.UpdatePreferencesResponse$preferredCommi: Shows the updated preferences for how Reserved Instances and Savings Plans cost-saving opportunities are prioritized in terms of payment option and term length.

refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesRequest$includeOrg: Indicates whether to return the enrollment status for the organization.
refs.ListRecommendationsRequest$includeAllRec: List of all recommendations for a resource, or a single recommendation if de-duped by resourceId.

RdsDbInstance.base: Contains the details of an Amazon RDS DB instance.

RdsDbInstanceConfiguration.base: The Amazon RDS DB instance configuration used for recommendations.

refs.RdsDbInstance$configuration: The Amazon RDS DB instance configuration used for recommendations.

RdsDbInstanceStorage.base: Contains the details of an Amazon RDS DB instance storage.

RdsDbInstanceStorageConfiguration.base: The Amazon RDS DB instance storage configuration used for recommendations.

refs.RdsDbInstanceStorage$configuration: The Amazon RDS DB instance storage configuration used for recommendations.

RdsReservedInstancesConfiguration.base: The RDS reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.RdsReservedInstances$configuration: The RDS reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

RecommendationSummary.base: The summary of rightsizing recommendations, including de-duped savings from all types of recommendations.

RedshiftReservedInstancesConfiguration.base: The Redshift reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.RedshiftReservedInstances$configuration: The Redshift reserved instances configuration used for recommendations.

refs.Filter$regions: The Amazon Web Services Region of the resource.

ReservedInstancesPricing.base: Pricing details for your recommended reserved instance.

refs.Filter$resourceArns: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recommendation.

ResourceDetails.base: Contains detailed information about the specified resource.

ResourceNotFoundException.base: The specified Amazon Resource Name (ARN) in the request doesn't exist.

ResourcePricing.base: Contains pricing information about the specified resource.

refs.ResourceDetails$sageMakerSavingsPlans: The SageMaker AI Savings Plans recommendation details.

SageMakerSavingsPlansConfiguration.base: The SageMaker Savings Plans configuration used for recommendations.

refs.SageMakerSavingsPlans$configuration: The SageMaker Savings Plans configuration used for recommendations.

refs.GetPreferencesResponse$savingsEstimation: Retrieves the status of the "savings estimation mode" preference.
refs.UpdatePreferencesResponse$savingsEstimat: Shows the status of the "savings estimation mode" preference.

refs.ComputeSavingsPlans$costCalculation: Cost impact of the Savings Plans purchase recommendation.
refs.Ec2InstanceSavingsPlans$costCalculation: Cost impact of the Savings Plans purchase recommendation.
refs.SageMakerSavingsPlans$costCalculation: Cost impact of the Savings Plans purchase recommendation.

refs.EbsVolumeConfiguration$storage: The disk storage of the Amazon Elastic Block Store volume.

refs.AuroraDbClusterStorageConfiguration$stor: The storage type to associate with the Aurora DB cluster.
refs.ComputeConfiguration$platform: The platform of the resource. The platform is the specific combination of operating system, license model, and software on an instance.
refs.ComputeSavingsPlansConfiguration$account: The account scope for which you want recommendations. Amazon Web Services calculates recommendations including the management account and member accounts if the value is set to PAYER. If the value is LINKED, recommendations are calculated for individual member accounts only.

refs.ComputeSavingsPlansConfiguration$hourlyC: The hourly commitment for the Savings Plans type.
refs.DbInstanceConfiguration$dbInstanceClass: The DB instance class of the DB instance.

refs.DynamoDbReservedCapacityConfiguration$mo: How much purchasing this reserved capacity costs you on a monthly basis.
refs.DynamoDbReservedCapacityConfiguration$nu: The number of reserved capacity units that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
refs.DynamoDbReservedCapacityConfiguration$ca: The capacity unit of the recommended reservation.
refs.EbsVolumeConfiguration$attachmentState: The Amazon Elastic Block Store attachment state.

refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$monthl: How much purchasing these reserved instances costs you on a monthly basis.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$normal: The number of normalized units that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$number: The number of instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$offeri: Indicates whether the recommendation is for standard or convertible reservations.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$instan: The instance family of the recommended reservation.
The type of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$curren: Determines whether the recommendation is for a current generation instance.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$platfo: The platform of the recommended reservation. The platform is the specific combination of operating system, license model, and software on an instance.
refs.Ec2ReservedInstancesConfiguration$tenanc: Determines whether the recommended reservation is dedicated or shared.
refs.EfficiencyMetricsByGroup$group: The value of the grouping dimension for this set of metrics. For example, if grouped by account ID, this field contains the account ID. If no grouping is specified, this field is empty.
refs.EfficiencyMetricsByGroup$message: An explanation of why efficiency metrics could not be calculated for this group when the metricsByTime field is null. Common reasons include insufficient or inconclusive cost and usage data during the specified time period. This field is null or empty when metrics are successfully calculated.
refs.ElastiCacheReservedInstancesConfiguratio: The account scope for which you want recommendations.
The service for which you want recommendations.

refs.GetRecommendationResponse$resourceId: The unique identifier for the resource. This is the same as the Amazon Resource Name (ARN), if available.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$resourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$accountId: The account to which the recommendation applies.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$currencyCode: The currency code used for the recommendation.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$region: The Amazon Web Services Region of the resource.
refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsRequest$groupBy: The dimension by which to group the cost efficiency metrics. Valid values include account ID, Amazon Web Services Region. When no grouping is specified, metrics are aggregated across all resources in the specified time period.
refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsRequest$nextToken: The token to retrieve the next page of results. This value is returned in the response when the number of groups exceeds the specified maxResults value.
refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsResponse$nextToken: The token to retrieve the next page of results. When this value is present in the response, additional groups are available. Pass this token in the nextToken parameter of a subsequent request to retrieve the next page.
refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesRequest$nextToken: The token to retrieve the next set of results.
refs.ListEnrollmentStatusesResponse$nextToken: The token to retrieve the next set of results.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesRequest$group: The grouping of recommendations by a dimension.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesRequest$nextT: The token to retrieve the next set of results.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesResponse$grou: The dimension used to group the recommendations by.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesResponse$curr: The currency code used for the recommendation.
refs.ListRecommendationSummariesResponse$next: The token to retrieve the next set of results.
refs.ListRecommendationsRequest$nextToken: The token to retrieve the next set of results.
refs.ListRecommendationsResponse$nextToken: The token to retrieve the next set of results.

The database engine that the recommended reservation supports.

refs.SageMakerSavingsPlansConfiguration$term: The Savings Plans recommendation term in years.
refs.SageMakerSavingsPlansConfiguration$hourl: The hourly commitment for the Savings Plans type.
refs.SummaryMetricsResult$savingsPercentage:
The savings percentage based on your Amazon Web Services spend over the past 30 days.

Savings percentage is only supported when filtering by Region, account ID, or tags.
refs.Tag$key: The key that's associated with the tag.
refs.Tag$value: The value that's associated with the tag.
refs.TimePeriod$start: The beginning of the time period (inclusive). Specify the date in ISO 8601 format, such as 2024-01-01.
refs.TimePeriod$end: The end of the time period (exclusive). Specify the date in ISO 8601 format, such as 2024-12-31.
refs.ValidationExceptionDetail$fieldName: The field name where the invalid entry was detected.
refs.ValidationExceptionDetail$message: A message with the reason for the validation exception error.

refs.ListRecommendationSummariesRequest$metri: Additional metrics to be returned for the request. The only valid value is savingsPercentage.

SummaryMetricsResult.base: The results or descriptions for the additional metrics, based on whether the metrics were or were not requested.

refs.ListRecommendationSummariesResponse$metr: The results or descriptions for the additional metrics, based on whether the metrics were or were not requested.

Tag.base: The tag structure that contains a tag key and value.

refs.Filter$tags: A list of tags assigned to the recommendation.
refs.GetRecommendationResponse$tags: A list of tags associated with the resource for which the recommendation exists.
refs.Recommendation$tags: A list of tags assigned to the recommendation.

refs.PreferredCommitment$term: The preferred length of the commitment period. If the value is null, it will default to ThreeYears (highest savings) where applicable.

ThrottlingException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling.

TimePeriod.base: Specifies a date range for retrieving efficiency metrics. The start date is inclusive and the end date is exclusive.

refs.ListEfficiencyMetricsRequest$timePeriod: The time period for which to retrieve the cost efficiency metrics. The start date is inclusive and the end date is exclusive. Dates can be specified in either YYYY-MM-DD format or YYYY-MM format depending on the desired granularity.

refs.AccountEnrollmentStatus$lastUpdatedTimes: The time when the account enrollment status was last updated.
refs.AccountEnrollmentStatus$createdTimestamp: The time when the account enrollment status was created.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy the constraints specified by an Amazon Web Services service.

ValidationExceptionDetail.base: The input failed to meet the constraints specified by the Amazon Web Services service in a specified field.

refs.ValidationException$fields: The list of fields that are invalid.
